page.title: 13Interview with Mrs. Sutton
page.content: We asked Mrs. Sutton to talk to us because when she first married in 1950 she lived in a house which stood where the school's newest classroom is now. She told us that the house had been built when the school was built and had been made in the same way in that it looked like part of the school and even had lattice windows like the school. It was built for the Head teacher but the last one lived there in 1938. When Mrs. Sutton lived there there was no electricity or mains water or drainage. They used oil lamps and fetched the water from the well in the Vicararge garden. Cooking was done on a range which had to be polished with black lead and the scullery floor was red brick. She told us about shortages after the War and showed us some photos.
